newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian wool indicator falls 4c to 566c/kg.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian wool indicator falls 4c to 566c/kg.

text.p: The Australian wool market eastern indicator fell by 4.0 cents to 566 cents a kg clean at sales in Sydney and Adelaide on Tuesday, Wool International (WI) said.
Merino fleece prices were cheaper, with the 19 micron indicator 1.5 percent cheaper and 20/21m slightly cheaper.
The 22m category was 0.5 percent cheaper and 23/24/25/26m 1.0 percent cheaper, WI said.
In crossbreds, 27m was unchanged, 28m 0.5 percent dearer, 29/31m up to 0.5 percent cheaper and 30m 1.0 percent cheaper.
Cardings were slightly cheaper, WI said.
WI said Japanese and Chinese interests were principal buyers with good support from Taiwan.
Of 31,420 bales offered in both centres, 10.8 percent were passed in.
Sales continue on Wednesday in Sydney, Adelaide and Fremantle with about 42,000 bales to be offered.
